content:
Thunderbird expects an email to contain character @ and some characters before and after it. Otherwise the Send Button is grayed out.

Example of email that will gray out Send button  : aaa@ or @gmail.com
creator: MichelT

content: If you have the account hub enabled in Settings/General, disable it and add the account from â‡¶ - New Account - Email.

creator: mlvolosyn

content: Not from within the program, as far as I know. You could save the email as .eml format, which is plain text and edit that with a text editor, then import it back into Thunderbird.
creator: rednoise

content: There are two add-ons, Header Tools Improved and Header Tools Lite.
creator: sfhowes

content: Editing the header is nice but I wanted to edit the body of the message. It looks like that's not an option in TB right now.
